metadata.title: CVE-2020-2951 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox product of Oracle Virtualization(component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are Prior to5.2.40, prior to 6.0.20 and prior to 6.1.6. Easily exploitablevulnerability allows low privileged attacker with logon to theinfrastructure where Oracle VM VirtualBox executes to compromise Oracle VMVirtualBox. While the vulnerability is in Oracle VM VirtualBox, attacks maysignificantly impact additional products. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang orfrequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of Oracle VM VirtualBox. CVSS3.0 Base Score 6.5 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-dkms - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-guest-utils - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-qt - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-source - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.18-dfsg-5').
